meanings.definition: A purchasing method where a customer pays for an item in installments before taking possession of it.
meanings.sent1: I put the toy on layaway and paid a little bit each week until I could bring it home.
meanings.sent2: My mom used layaway to buy my birthday present slowly over a few months.
meanings.sent3: The layaway plan helped me save up for the new video game without spending all my money at once.
meanings.sent4: Using layaway felt like a game where I had to collect enough coins to unlock the prize.
meanings.sent5: The layaway process made me feel like I was earning the toy through hard work and patience.

meanings.definition: To put an item on hold and pay for it over time before receiving it.
meanings.sent1: I will layaway the dress for prom so I can pay for it bit by bit.
meanings.sent2: She decided to layaway the furniture set to furnish her new apartment.
meanings.sent3: I joked that I would layaway the entire store if I could pay for everything over time.
meanings.sent4: The idea to layaway the vacation seemed like a dream come true.
meanings.sent5: He planned to layaway the car to avoid a large upfront payment.
